metadata.notes: Representative subset covering all categories and difficulty levels for scoring system calibration

questions.prompt: Explain how to design a hierarchical multi-agent system for complex problem-solving. Include the key architectural components, communication patterns, and coordination mechanisms.
questions.rationale: Core architecture question that tests comprehensive coverage and technical depth

questions.prompt: You are building a system where multiple AI agents work together to analyze large datasets. Design the communication protocol between agents, including message formats, routing strategies, and error handling mechanisms.
questions.rationale: Tests technical specification writing and detailed implementation coverage

questions.prompt: Compare different coordination strategies for hierarchical agents: centralized vs decentralized vs hybrid approaches. When would you use each one?
questions.rationale: Tests analytical comparison and structured reasoning abilities

questions.prompt: Design a Supabase schema for a multi-tenant SaaS application with user authentication, organization management, and role-based permissions. Include RLS policies.
questions.rationale: Tests technical implementation detail and code quality in different domain

questions.prompt: Explain how to implement real-time subscriptions in Supabase with PostgreSQL triggers and functions. Include performance considerations and best practices.
questions.rationale: Tests educational writing style and technical implementation coverage

questions.prompt: Write a comprehensive guide on effective technical writing for software documentation. Cover structure, clarity, audience considerations, and maintenance practices.
questions.rationale: Tests writing quality, style, and tone in meta-domain about writing itself

questions.prompt: Explain how to write clear and actionable bug reports that help developers quickly understand and fix issues. Include examples of good and bad reports.
questions.rationale: Tests basic writing clarity and practical communication skills

questions.prompt: Design a fault-tolerant hierarchical agent system that can handle individual agent failures without compromising the overall system performance. Include recovery mechanisms and load redistribution strategies.
questions.rationale: Advanced system design testing comprehensive technical coverage

questions.prompt: Write SQL queries to analyze user engagement patterns in a Supabase application. Include weekly active users, retention rates, and feature usage analytics.
questions.rationale: Tests specific SQL implementation and instruction following

questions.prompt: Create a style guide for writing API documentation that is both comprehensive and beginner-friendly. Address endpoint descriptions, parameter documentation, and example usage.
questions.rationale: Tests comprehensive documentation writing and authoritative style

questions.prompt: How would you implement task prioritization and resource allocation in a hierarchical multi-agent system with limited computational resources?
questions.rationale: Tests algorithmic thinking and technical detail specification

questions.prompt: Optimize a slow-performing Supabase query that joins multiple large tables. Provide indexing strategies, query restructuring options, and performance monitoring techniques.
questions.rationale: Tests advanced technical problem-solving and optimization knowledge

focus_areas: Emphasize presentation quality over factual correctness
Rate completeness and comprehensiveness of coverage
Assess technical depth and specific examples
Consider writing style and tone appropriateness
Check adherence to format and instruction requirements
special_considerations: Different question categories may emphasize different dimensions
Advanced questions expect higher technical depth
Writing questions should be evaluated for communication effectiveness
SQL questions should include assessment of code quality and practicality
